abstract: As Google continues to outmaneuver its main search rivals, Yahoo and Microsoft, plenty of newcomers – with names like Powerset, hakia, ChaCha and Snap – are trying to beat the company at its own game. And Wikia, a company started by a founder of Wikipedia, plans to develop a search engine that, like the popular Web-based encyclopedia, would be built by a community of programmers and users.
lead_paragraph: As Google continues to outmaneuver its main search rivals, Yahoo and Microsoft, plenty of newcomers – with names like Powerset, hakia, ChaCha and Snap – are trying to beat the company at its own game. And Wikia, a company started by a founder of Wikipedia, plans to develop a search engine that, like the popular Web-based encyclopedia, would be built by a community of programmers and users.

headline.main: In Silicon Valley, the Race Is On to Trump Google
